thread.title: Apple TV could be a games console to rival PlayStation and Xbox - but will it get FIFA?
thread.title_full: Apple TV could be a games console to rival PlayStation and Xbox - but will it get FIFA?

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Apple TV could be a games console to rival PlayStation and Xbox - but will it get FIFA?
text:
Apple had a busy evening yesterday . 
Along with new iPhones and a giant iPad , the company has moved in on video games with an updated Apple TV set-top box. 
For the first time, companies will be able to develop apps and games directly for the Apple TV , just like they do with the iPhone's app store. 
It will use brand new software called tvOS. 
Apple also unveiled a new remote that includes an accelerometer and a gyroscope, meaning it can be used like a Nintendo Wii controller. Reuters Eddie Cue, Apple's senior vice president of Internet Software and Services, takes the stage to discuss Apple TV 
There's also a touchpad at the top of the control that can be used to control games. 
The Apple TV will have its own dedicated app store and, according to CEO Tim Cook, is "the future of television". 
An example of a game being played on the new Apple TV 
But could it replace the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One the same way the iPhone has replaced the Game Boy and PS Vita for casual mobile gaming? 
"Apple excels at making tech products for non-tech people," said Jason Kingsley, co-founder of Oxford-based games developer, Rebellion. 
Should the PlayStation be worried? 
“For Apple’s App store it might enable a much needed shake-up as whenever there’s a ‘new toy’ to play with, there are disruptive companies which rise to the top to capitalise on new gameplay styles and take over from previous platform titans." 
At the moment, the Apple TV has a 200MB limit for apps and games. But the gadgets themselves have a choice of either 32GB or 64GB of storage - plenty of space if needed. 
Crossy Road is an addictive iPhone game - and now you can play it on your TV 
"If Apple can release a £150 box that plays all the games normal people want to play when they get home from the pub, why would casual gamers shell out £400 for a Playstation 4?" Asks Mirror Online's Mikey Smith. 
FIFA is currently available for the iPhone, but will it come to Apple TV? Mirror Tech has put this question to publisher EA and will update this story when we hear back. Poll loading …
